channel.title: Uberflip Help Center Articles - Data dictionary
channel.description: Latest articles from Uberflip Help Center

item.title: The Uberflip data dictionary
item.description:
A
Account ID A unique identifier for an Uberflip Account, which may include multiple Hubs.
Asset Name Represents the name of any asset used
   
B

Section 2 content goes here.

C

Section 3 content goes here.

D

Section 4 content goes here.

E

Section 5 content goes here.

F

Section 5 content goes here.

G

Section 5 content goes here.

H

Section 5 content goes here.

I

Section 5 content goes here.

J

Section 5 content goes here.

K

Section 5 content goes here.

L

Section 5 content goes here.

item.title: Flipbooks (Content > Analytics)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Flipbook content is a set of attributes specific to Uberflip Flipbooks.  
Includes these data points
  • Flipbook Created Date
  • Flipbook Folder
  • Flipbook ID
  • Flipbook is Deleted (Yes / No)
  • Flipbook Publish Date
  • Flipbook Title
  • Flipbook Total Pages
Data Available After

Always in sync with database.
Value

Flipbook content attributes can provide information about flipbooks that is independent of Hubs or Item information.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Not Available.

 

Flipbook Created Date

Data Type: Date

Description: When a Flipbook was created


Flipbook Folder

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The folder the Flipbook is located in.

 

Flipbook ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The unique identifier for a flipbook, not to be confused with the Item ID.

 

Is Flipbook Deleted

Data Type: Dimension

Description: If a Flipbook has been deleted from Uberflip.


Flipbook Publish Date

Data Type: Date

Description The date the Flipbook was Published


Flipbook Title

Data type: Dimension

Description: The title of the Flipbook, which is independent of the item title


Flipbook Total Pages

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The total number of pages included with a Flipbook.

item.title: Filter-Only (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

A set of fields that can only be used for filters
Includes these data points
  • View Date (Filter Only)
Data Available After

July 2019
Value

These  filters will allow to see information in a date range based on negative cases.  Such as show me all the events that didn't fire in a particular date range.
Google Analytics Equivalent

It is not possible to see content that wasn't viewed in a time-frame with Google Analysis

 

Item Creator

Data Type: Date

Description: Use this as a filter to show items with 0 page views in date range.

item.title: Account ID (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:

The Account ID is the numerical ID used to distinguished Uberflip Accounts between each other. 
Includes these data points
  • Account ID
Data available after

Always in sync with database
Value

Allows users with multiple accounts to differentiate between them and helps customer support debug issues easier.
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Custom dimension required.

item.title: CTAs: Forms (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:

Form CTA content dimensions provide context to Form CTAs and helps distinguish them from one-another.
Includes these data points

Dimensions

  • CTA ID
  • Form CTA Label
  • Form CTA Position
  • Form CTA Tagline
  • Form CTA Tagline & Button
  • Form CTA Title
  • Form CTA Title & Link
  • Is Form CTA Deleted

 
Data available after

Always in sync with database
Value

Leads generated from Form CTA submissions are one of the most important business oriented KPIs for marketers.  The details of those CTAs can illuminate what is working and what is not.
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Requires custom dimensions and will not be in sync with the DB.


CTA ID 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The Unique identifier of a CTA.

 

Form CTA Label

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Text shown on the Form CTA's submission button.

 

Form CTA Position

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Where the CTA is included, which may be Gated, Show-beside, Stream or Embed.

 

Form CTA Tagline

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Text shown on the CTA to give context.

 

Form CTA Tagline & Button

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A data cell styled to include both the CTA Tagline & button

 

Form CTA Title: 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The internal title of a CTA.

 

Form CTA Title & Link

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A data cell that includes the CTA's title as well as a link to view the CTA in Uberflip.

 

Is Form CTA Deleted

Description: An indication if the CTA has been deleted.

item.title: CTAs: Link (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Link CTA Content information provides context to differentiate Link CTAs from each other.
Includes these data points
  • CTA ID
  • Link CTA Button Label
  • Link CTA Position
  • Link CTA Tagline
  • Link CTA Tagline & Button
  • Link CTA Title
  • Link CTA Title & Link
  • Is Link CTA Deleted
Data available after

Always in sync with database
Value

CTA Content dimensions provide awareness of what Link CTAs visitors are seeing and where they see them.

It is important to compare position and the content of a CTA when considering why it may have performed how it did.
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Requires custom dimensions and will not be in sync with the DB.

 

CTA ID 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The Unique identifier of a CTA.

 

Link CTA Button Label

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Text shown on the CTA's submission button.

 

Form CTA Position

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Where the CTA is included, which may be Gated, Show-beside, Stream or Embed.

 

Form CTA Tagline

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Text shown on the CTA to give context.

 

Form CTA Tagline & Button

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A data cell styled to include both the CTA Tagline & button

 

Form CTA Title: 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The internal title of a CTA.

 

Form CTA Title & Link

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A data cell that includes the CTA's title as well as a link to view the CTA in Uberflip.

 

Is Form CTA Deleted

Description: An indication if the CTA has been deleted.

item.title: Hubs (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Hub content dimensions help distinguished Uberflip Hubs from one another.
Includes these data points
  • Hub ID
  • Hub Name
Data Available After

Always in sync with database.
Value

It's important to differentiate Hubs from one another because they are usually applied to either different business units or different use-cases.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Google usually handles each Hub as a different website.


 

Hub ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The unique identifier used to distinguished hubs from one another.


Hub Name

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The internal name used to identify a Hub

item.title: Item Created Date (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Item Created Date indicates when an item was initially made.  
Includes these data points

Different intervals for when items were created.
Collection Start

Always in sync with database.
Purpose / Value

When auditing content it is important to understand when content was created to better understand how efforts impacted performance.
Google Analytics Equivalent

Custom dimensions required.

item.title: Item Modified Date (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

The Item Modified Date indicates when an item was last altered
Includes these data points

Different intervals for when items were modified.
Collection Start

Always in sync with database.
Value

To check if an item was modified leading it to perform differently based on that modification
Google Analytics Equivalent

Custom dimensions required.

item.title: Item (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Item Content Dimensions are identifiers that help distinguish one piece of content from another.  
Includes these data points

Dimensions

  • Item Canonical Redirect
  • Item Canonical URL
  • Item Creator
  • Item Description
  • Item ID
  • Item is Deleted (Yes/No)
  • Item Is Hidden
  • Item Title + Image
  • Item Primary URL Slug
  • Item SEO Description
  • Item SEO Title
  • Item Thumbnail URL
  • Item Title
  • Item Type

Measures

  • Items with Page Views
  • List Items
  • Total Items
Collection Start

Always in sync with database.
Value

These fields are required to differentiate items and give Analytics context.  With these differentiators it's easy to aggregate metrics at the item level from across streams and also to see which items are being viewed by visitors.
Google Analytics Equivalent

Requires custom dimensions to be set up for these data-points

You will also need to set up filters in Google Analytics to Aggregate data from. 

 

Canonical Redirect

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Does this Item have a canonical redirect set up for search engines.  

Item Canonical URL

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The URL recognizes by Web browsers as the home for this content.  


Item Creator

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The name of the Uberflip user that created an Item, which is different than the Item author.  

Item Description

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The item's description exposed on the front-end of the application

Item ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The unique identifier of an Item.

 

Item is Deleted (Yes/No)

Data Type: Boolean

Description: An indication if the item has been deleted.

Item is Hidden (Yes/No)

Data Type: Boolean

Description: If an Item has been declared Hidden from viewing in a stream.

Item Title + Image

Data Type: HTML 

Description: An HTML enriched cell that can be used to visually list items.

Item Primary URL Slug

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The item's representation in the URL

Item SEO Description

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The Description  displayed in search engines.

Item SEO Title

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The title displayed in Search Engines


Item Thumbnail URL

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Generate a URL to view the item's thumbnail, which can help better identify the item.

 

Item Title

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The visitor facing title of an item.

Item Type

Data Type: Dimension

Description: This is based on system set Item items, which include Blogpost, Slideshare, Twitter, Youtube, Wistia etc...

Items with Page Views

Data Type: count

Description: A count of items that have received at least 1 page view in a date range.

 

List Items

Data Type: String

Description: A comma delimitated list of items

 

Total Items

Data Type: Count

Description: A count of items regardless of views or not

item.title: Page Type (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What is it

Page Type is a content dimension that indicates if a page is a stream, an item, author, stream login etc..
Includes these data points
  • Page Type
Date available after

Synced with Database
Purpose

This allows the user to differentiate between different kinds of pages to analyze different kinds of pages, which are used for different purposes.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Requires custom Dimensions

 

Page Type

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A distinction given to different types of pages.

item.title: Stream Created Date (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Stream created date is when a stream was originally made.  
Includes these data points

Various date periods to analyze 
Data available after

Always in sync with database
Value

It's important to understand when streams are being created to understand Uberflip Usage and to see recent content experiences being published.  
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Custom Dimension Required.

item.title: Stream (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
What is it

Stream identifiers that help differentiate Streams from each other and provides contextual details. 
Includes these data points

Dimensions:

  • Canonical Redirect
  • Category
  • Description
  • Force Self Canonical
  • ID
  • Is Deleted
  • Is Hidden 
  • Owner
  • Primary URL Slug
  • SEO Description
  • SEO Settings
  • SEO Title
  • Stream Authentication
  • Stream Purpose
  • Stream Title & Category
  • Title
  • Type

Measures:

  • Count Stream Owners
  • Count Stream Owners with Views
  • Count Streams
  • Count Streams Incl Deleted
  • List Streams 
  • Streams with Page Views
 Value

As purposeful collections of content, Streams are an incredibly important tool in designing a content experience.

Stream dimensions and measures make it easy to differentiate Streams and to aggregate them into counts.
Google Analytics Equivalent

The closest equivalent to Streams in Google Analytics are pages. Significant customization through custom dimensions would be required to gather this data.

 

Canonical Redirect

Data Type: Dimension

Description: If this Stream set up for canonical redirect.

Category

Data Type: Dimension

Description: An aggregation of  types to high-level categories that include include Blogs, Documents, Marketing, Sales, Social and Video.

Description

Data Type: Dimension

Description: An aggregation of  types to high-level categories that include include Blogs, Documents, Marketing, Sales, Social and Video.

 

Force Self Canonical

Data Type: Dimension

Description:  Does this Stream represent its self to search engines as it's canonical URL

ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Unique Identifier for an individual Stream.

Is Deleted

Data Type: Dimension

Description: If the Stream has been deleted/archived or not.

Is Hidden

Data Type: Dimension

Description: If the Stream has been hidden from search engines and navigation.

 

Owner 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The Uberflip user who is assigned as the owner of the Stream.


Primary URL Slug

Data Type: Dimension

Description: How this Stream is represented in the URL

SEO Description

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The Stream description displayed by search engines.

 

SEO Settings

Data Type: Dimension

Description: How a Stream is configured to be viewed by search engines.

 

SEO Title

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The title used for a Stream in search engines.  

 

Stream Authentication

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Is a Stream configured to require authentication/password to access it.

 

Stream Purpose

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The value assigned as the Stream Purpose for this Stream, indicating what it was intended to be used for.

 

Stream Title & Category

Data Type: Dimension

Description: An HTML cell that includes information about a Stream for clear context.

 

Title

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The external title of a Stream.

 

Type 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The type of Stream, e.g. Blog, YouTube, Marketing, Sales, etc.


Count Stream Owners

Data Type: Measure

Description: A sum of total Stream owners.

Count Stream Owners with Views

Data Type: Measure

Description A sum of total Stream owners with views in a time-frame.

 

Count Streams

Data Type: Measure

Description: A count of Streams that can be used in different contexts that doesn't include deleted Streams.

 

Count Streams Incl Deleted

Data Type: Measure

Description: A count of Streams that can be used in different contexts that includes deleted Streams.

 

List Streams

Data Type: Measure

Description: A comma delineated list of Streams.

 

Streams with Page Views

Data Type:  Measure

Description: A count/sum of Streams that have had page views within a time period.

item.title: Tags (Analytics > Content)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Tag content identifiers allow the usage of item tags within Uberflip analytics.
Includes these data points
  • Item Tags
  • Tag
  • List Tags
  • Count Tags
Data Available After

Always in sync with database.
Value

Tags provide valuable valuable aggregation to content stored in Uberflip.  With Tags it's possible to identify groups of content to either exclusively analyze or exclude from analysis.  

It's also possible to surface tags in context of stream or item analytics to understand the the purposes of those.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Custom dimensions required.

 

Item Tags

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A list of tags that are on the same item.  This is useful for identifying items that don't have a specific tag.

Tag

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Provide a single item tag, which can be used to filter a dashboard or to analyze on its own.

 

List Tags

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Provide a list of item tags in a comma delimited.

 

Count Tags

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of item tags that can be drilled into.

item.title: Form CTA Impression/Submission Date (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:

The Form CTA Impression date is when a form CTA was seen by a visitor, where as the submission date was when it was actually submitted.  

 
Includes these data points
  • Form CTA Impression Date
  • Link CTA Submission Date
Data available after

October 2019 (Collection on Hubs)

May 2020 (Collection of Embedded CTAs)

Pending (Collection of Embedded on Hubs)
Value

By providing Form CTA event dates we can understand when they were interacted with.  This information can be utilized for the following purposes:

- Graph Impressions or Submissions

- See when a specific users had an impression or submission

- See the time in-between seeing a CTA and actually submitting it.  
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Custom event required

 

Form CTA Impression Date

Data type: Date

Description: When a Form CTA was at least 50% on screen for more than 1 second.


Form CTA Submission Date

Data type: Date

Description: When a Form CTA was successfully submitted.

item.title: Link CTA Impression / Click Date (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:

Link CTA Impressions and Click Dates are when different CTA Events were tracked. 
Includes these data points
  • Link CTA Impression Date
  • Link CTA Click Date
Data available after

October 2019 (Collection on Hubs)

May 2020 (Collection of Embedded CTAs)

Pending (Collection of Embedded on Hubs)
Value

By providing date information on Link CTAs we can better understand when they were interacted with.  We can use this information for graphing purposes or to simply state for a specific visitor when they interacted with a Link CTA.
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Custom Even required


Link CTA Impression Date

Data Type: Date

Description: When a Link CTA was at least 50% on screen for more than 1 second.

 

Link CTA Click Date

Data Type: Date

Description: When a Link CTA was clicked.

item.title: Page View Date (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:

The Page View Date for when a single page/URL was viewed by a visitor.
Includes these data points
 Various time frames for analysis.
Data available after

July 2019 (start collecting page view data)
Value

Page View Date is the primary contextual date in Uberflip Analytics.  All dashboards use Page view date as the default date filter.  

The reason for this is that almost all activity in Uberflip Analytics is attached to a page view, therefore that is often the most appropriate date to filter traffic
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Google analytics data is primarily based on page views by date.

The View Date (filter only) dimension

In addition to the dimensions available under Engagement > Page View Date, there is also a separate dimension named View Date (filter only) that is available in Uberflip Analytics Explore. This dimension works the same way as as the dimensions under Page View Date, except:

  • It can only be used as a filter in Explore
  • It includes pages that had 0 page views during the selected timeframe, which the Page View Date dimensions do not

item.title: Session Created Date (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

The date and time for when a visitor session starts.  
Includes these data points
 Various time frames for analysis
Data available after

July 2019 (start collecting session data)
Value

The session start date allows for both graphing when sessions start, listing sessions by the most recent and also to filter out sessions that occurred in certain date/time ranges
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable:

Part of Google analytics core product

item.title: Visitor Facts (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What is it

Visitor Facts are aggregated values that cover all of Uberflip recorded history, cannot be filtered and cannot be drilled
Collection Start

July 2019: Started collection
Included fields
  • Lifetime Distinct Items Viewed
  • Lifetime Distinct Streams Viewed
  • Lifetime Distinct Tags Viewed
  • Lifetime Link CTAs Clicked
  • Lifetime Form CTAs Submitted
  • Lifetime Page Views
Value

When generating a list of visitor actives it's usually important to filter by a date range or other parameters. 

Visitor facts let you see information outside of those filter parameters.  

For Example, if I filtered by Item & Date, Visitor facts could show you a count of total items viewed by that visitor from all time.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

These can be set up with a Combination of User Explore and custom dimensions.

 

Lifetime Distinct Items Viewed 

Data Type: Dimension

Description: For a single visitor, this is a count of all the different items they have ever viewed.

 

Lifetime Distinct Streams Viewed

Data type: Dimension

 Description: For a single visitor, this is a count of all the different streams they have ever viewed.

 

Lifetime Distinct Tags Viewed

Data type: Dimension

Description: For a single visitor this is a count of all the different tags they have ever viewed.

 

Lifetime Link CTAs Clicked

Data type: Dimension

Description: For a single visitor this is a count of all the Link CTAs they clicked.

 

Lifetime Form CTAs Submitted

Data type: Dimension

Description: For a single visitor this is a count of all the Form CTAs they clicked.

 

Lifetime Page Views

Data type: Dimension

Description: For a single visitor this is a count of all the Form CTAs they clicked.

item.title: Avg. Scroll Depth (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What is it:

Avg. Scroll Depth is how far down a page a visitor scrolled. This takes into account the page height at initial load and then the total of that percentage viewed by the visitor.

If there is a "Read More" button, or there is auto-loaded content this may cause the page heigh to be above 100%.  
Includes these data points
  • Avg. Scroll Depth
Date available after

December 2019 (collection started of scroll depth)
Purpose

Scroll depth is an important indicator especially for blogs/articles as it indicator if a visitor actually read the content.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

This would need to be enabled with Google Tag Manager and possibly use some additional code.

 

Avg. Scroll Depth

Data Type: Calculated

Description: An average of scroll depth percentages.

item.title: Bounce (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Bounce indicates if a visitor takes an action during their session.

An Uberflip visitor is considered bounced if all of the following are true:

  • Only 1 page viewed
  • No Form CTA Submitted
  • No Link CTA Clicked
Includes these data points
  • Bounce Rate
  • Bounces
Data Available After

July 2019 (Collection date started for Bounce Rate and Total Bounces)
Purpose

A bounce is the clearest indication of visitor engagement.
Google Analytics Equivalent

Google Analytics visitors are considered bounced if all the following are true:

  • Only 1 page viewed
  • No custom event fired (depends on implementation)

 

Bounce Rate

Data Type: Calculated

Description: An average of the bounce rate percentages.  

 

Bounce 

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of total bounces.

item.title: Flipbooks (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is:
 Data points related to Uberflip Flipbook documents
Includes these data points
  • Total Flipbook Document Page Views
  • Flipbook Downloads
  • Avg. Flipbook Document Page Views
Data available after

May 2020 (collection start date for Flipbook Downloads and Total Flipbook Document Page Views)
Purpose

Flipbooks require a specific set of metrics to understand as their level of engagement is tracked by visitors viewing multiple pages or by visitors downloading them for offline reading/circulation.  
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable

None (Google Analytics custom event required)

 

Total Flipbook Document Page Views 

Data Type: Count

Description: A count of total pages within a Flipbook document. 

 

Flipbook Downloads 

Data Type: Count

Description: A count of how many times a Flipbook has been downloaded by visitors.

 

Avg. Flipbook Document Page Views 

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  An average of the amount of pages within Flipbook users have read.

item.title: Views (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Views is an indicator of how many times a page or piece of content was loaded by a visitor. 
Includes these data points
  • Item Views
  • Page Views
  • Stream Views
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

A count that distinguishes different types of pages being viewed.
Google Analytics Equivalent

While page views is possible in Google Analytics, both stream views and item views would require custom dimensions to be set.

 

Item Views

Data Type: Count

Description: A drill-able sum of the number of times items were viewed

 

Page Views

Data Type: Count

Description: A drill-able sum of the number of times pages were viewed.

 

Stream Views

Data Type: Count

Description: A drill-able sum of the number of times streams were viewed.

item.title: Session (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Sessions engagement metrics capture KPIs for a single viewing period for a visitor.

A session is based on a short-lived  60 minute cookie, which renewed based on last activity.  A user can navigate away from a page/or background a tab and as long as they return within an hour then that will be considered as the same session.
Includes these data points
  • Avg. Session Duration
  • Avg. Session Duration Formatted
  • Count Sessions
  • Items Per Session
  • Pages Per Session
Collection Start

July 2019 - Started collecting view 
December 2019 - Started collection Duration information
Value

Understand key information about sessions, both how many there were and also what those sessions entailed.
Google Analytics Equivalent Google does track sessions.

Session duration is not very accurate in Google Analytics, as it is based strictly on the time stamp of page views.    

 

Avg. Session Duration

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  The Average length of user sessions, which is visualized in "mm:ss" format but exported as just "ss" format to allow for easy calculations.  The session duration is a sum of all active time viewing, which means if a tab is backgrounded then it does not count in the session duration.

 

Avg. Session Duration (Formatted)

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  The Average length of user sessions, which is visualized in "mm:ss" and exported as the same "mm:ss" so it cannot be used for calculations. The session duration is a sum of all active time viewing, which means if a tab is backgrounded then it does not count in the session duration.

 

Count Sessions

Data Type: Count

Description:  The total number of sessions. A session is a viewing period by a visitor that uses the same short-lived cookie (1-hour).  


Items Per Session

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  This is an average of the number of Items page views duration a session.  This is a very important KPI for differentiating what were navigation pages versus content pages.  Items are not distinct so a refresh of a page will count as another item view.

 

Pages Per Session

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  This is an average of the number of URLs a user views during a session.  Pages are not counted as distinct so refreshing a page will count as another page view.

item.title: Link CTA Engagement(Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Link CTA Engagement KPIs specifically around Link CTAs to track how visitors interact with them. 
Includes these data points
  • Link CTA Click-Through Rate
  • Link CTA Clicks
  • Link CTA Impressions
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

Depending on use, Link CTAs can be your primary KPI.  It is important to track if visitors saw your link CTAs and if they actually clicked on them
Google Analytics Equivalent

Tracking CTA interactions would require custom events to be set up.

 

Link CTA Click-Through Rate

Data Type: Calculated 

Description: An average that indicates the percentage of visitors that had an impression of a CTA and subsequently clicked on it.

 

Link CTA Clicks

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of times a visitor clicked on a Link CTA.

 

Link CTA Impressions

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of times a visitor viewed a Link CTA, which was 50% on screen  for at least 1 second.

item.title: Form CTA Engagement (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Form CTA Engagement are KPIs for understanding how visitors interact with forms, generally utilized for lead collection.
Includes these data points
  • Form CTA Activations
  • Form CTA Convert Rate
  • Form CTA Impressions
  • Form CTA Submissions
  • Gated Form CTA Convert Rate
  • Gated Form CTA Impressions
  • Gated Form CTA Submissions
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

Depending on use, Form CTAs can be your primary KPI, especially if used for lead collection.  It is important to track if visitors saw your forms, which activated them and then subsequently which actually submitted the form.
Google Analytics Equivalent

Tracking CTA interactions would require custom events to be set up.

 

Form CTA Activations

Data Type: Calculated 

Description: A sum of the number of times a Form CTA was clicked-into to access the actual form. 

 

Form CTA Convert Rate

Data Type: Calculated

Description: A percentage average of instances where a Form CTA had an Impression that subsequently led to a Form CTA Submission.   

 

Form CTA Impression

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of times a Form CTA was viewed  50% on screen for at least 1 second. 

 

Form CTA Submission

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of times a Form CTA was successfully filled out and delivered.

 

Gated Form CTA Convert Rate

Data Type: Calculated 

Description: A percentage average of instances where a Gated Form CTA (one that blocks access to content) had an Impression that subsequently led to a Form CTA Submission.   

 

Gated Form CTA Impressions

Data Type: Calculated 

Description: A sum of the number of times a Gated Form CTA (one that blocks access to content) was viewed  50% on screen for at least 1 second. 

 

Gated Form CTA Submission

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of times a Gated Form CTA (one that blocks access to content) was successfully filled out and delivered.

item.title: Time on Page (Analytics > Engagement)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Time on Page is a calculation of the time spent viewing different content or pages in Uberflip.  

This metric is tracked in 2 second intervals and only registers when the page is actively being viewed.  
Includes these data points
  • Avg. Time on Page
  • Avg. Time on Page - Formatted
Collection Start

December 2019 - started collecting time on page
Value

Understand how long a visitor has been viewing a single piece of content or the average time multiple visitors have been viewing content. 
Google Analytics Equivalent Google utilizes timestamps to calculate time on page.  This means that they can't give you the time spent in a single page view session or the last page in a session.


Avg. Time on Page

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  The average length users actively viewing a page in "mm:ss" format but exported as just "ss" format to allow for easy calculations.  

 

Avg. Session Duration (Formatted)

Data Type: Calculated

Description: The average length users actively viewing a page in"mm:ss" and exported as the same "mm:ss" so it cannot be used for calculations. 

 

Count Sessions

Data Type: Count

Description:  The total number of sessions. A session is a viewing period by a visitor that uses the same short-lived cookie (1-hour).  


Items Per Session

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  This is an average of the number of Items page views duration a session.  This is a very important KPI for differentiating what were navigation pages versus content pages.  Items are not distinct so a refresh of a page will count as another item view.

 

 

Pages Per Session

Data Type: Calculated

Description:  This is an average of the number of URLs a user views during a session.  Pages are not counted as distinct so refreshing a page will count as another page view.

item.title: Visitors (Engagement > Analytics)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Visitor Engagement KPIs help you understand what is happening for visitors across multiple sessions level.

A visitor is someone with a long-lived cookie, which will remain in the user's browser for 365 days.  This is renewed every time they return.  
Includes these data points
  • New Visitors
  • Pages Per Visitor
  • Return Visitors
  • Unique Visitors
Data available after

Always in sync with database.
Value

Understand if your content is drawing new visitors or are they coming back for multiple sessions.  Also show how much content is being consumed by a visitor through multiple sessions.
Google Analytics equivalent/comparable Part of Google Analytics.

 

New Visitors

Data Type: Count

Description:  A visitor is new if a browser cookie was seen only once.  


Pages Per Visitor

Data Type: Count

Description:  The number of pages viewed by a visitor, which may include the same page multiple times  

 

Return Visitor

Data Type: Count

Description:  A visitor is returned if their browser cookie has been seen before.

 

Unique Visitor

Data Type: Count

Description:  A visitor is unique based on counting individual browser cookies

item.title: Device Type (Analytics > Traffic)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Device Type Indicates what the browser's user-agent says the visitor's device is.
Includes these data points
  • Device type
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

It's possible to understand if a session is from a particular device, including desktop, laptop, mobile, tablet or console.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Google Analytics provides this information as well as hardware information, which Uberflip Analytics will implement at a future date.

 

Device Type

Data Type: Dimension

Description: Identifies distinct device types based on a pre-defined list provided by Uberflip.

item.title: Entry (Analytics > Traffic)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

An "Entry" is the first page or content viewed during a session.  
Includes these data points
  • Entry Hub ID
  • Entry Item
  • Entry Item ID
  • Entry Item Thumbnail URL
  • Entry Page
  • Entry Stream
  • Entry Stream ID
  • Entry URL
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

By understanding how visitors are entering the content experience, it is possible to see information. 
Google Analytics Equivalent

With google analytics, it's possible to utilize the Behavior functions to understand entry pages.

 

Entry Hub ID

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The unique identifier of the Hub where a session started.

 

Entry Item

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The distinct item title where a session started.

 

Entry Item ID

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The distinct item title where a session started.

 

Entry Item Thumbnail URL

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The thumbnail image representing the Entry Item.

 

Entry Page

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: A styled Cell that combines the Item Title, Stream Title and URL for where a session started.

 

Entry Stream

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The distinct Stream title where a sessions started.

 

Entry Stream ID

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The distinct Stream ID where sessions started.

 

Entry URL

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The distinct URL where sessions started.

item.title: Geography (Analytics > Traffic)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Geography data points identify the approximate location of a page view on based on IP address geo look-up.
Includes these data points
  • City
  • Country
  • Country Code
  • Country, Region, City
  • Region
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

Understand where traffic is originating from.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

Provides its own geography tools based on IP address.

 

City

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The approximate city of where traffic is coming form.  

 

Country

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: The approximate country of where traffic is coming form.  

 

Country Code

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: A standardized 3-letter code using the ISO 3166 to put countries on a map.

 

Country, Region, City

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: Condenses Country, City and Region into a dimensions.   

 

Region

Data Type: Dimension 

Description:The approximate state or province where traffic is coming form.  

 

Cities

Data Type: Cities

Description: A sum of cities where traffic originated from.  

 

Countries

Data Type: Cities

Description: A sum of cities where traffic originated from.  

 

Regions

Data Type: Countries

Description: A sum of  countries where traffic originated from.

item.title: ID Fields (Analytics > Traffic)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

Different unique identifiers (IDs) used to understand clear distinctions in traffic.
Includes these data points
  • Page View ID
  • Session ID
  • Visitor ID
  • Visitor UUID
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

These IDs can be used to specifically target specific instances and differentiate them.  
Google Analytics Equivalent

With google analytics, it's possible to utilize the Behavior functions to understand entry pages.

 

 

Page View ID

Data Type: Dimension 

Description: A unique identifier for a specific instance of a page view. 

 

Session ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A unique identifier for a specific session.  


Visitor ID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A short back-end only unique identifier for differentiating specific visitors.

 

Visitor UUID

Data Type: Dimension

Description: A front-end exposed unique identifier that can be used to identify and delete visitors.

item.title: UTM / URL (Anlaytics > Traffic)
item.description:
General Info

What it is

UTM / URL Anaytics provide Information pulled from URL parameters and referrals that indicate what the source of traffic was.

Standard UTM Parameters are utilized as shown here:

https://ga-dev-tools.appspot.com/campaign-url-builder/
Includes these data points

Dimensions

  • Full URL w/ Params
  • URL
  • URL Parameters
  • UTM Campaign
  • UTM Content
  • UTM Medium
  • UTM Source
  • UTM Source & Medium

Measures

  • Distinct URLs
  • UTM Campaigns
  • UTM Content
  • UTM Source & Medium
Collection Start

July 2019
Value

These parameters are vital in understanding what the source of traffic is coming from and where they are landing.
Google Analytics Equivalent

Google provides extensive tools to understand referral traffic 

 

 

Full URL w/ Params

Data Type: Dimension

Description: The entire URL as it's shown in the address bar.  This includes additional parameters a query strings, which are both standard UTM and custom.  This will show embed configurations as well.  

 

Full URL Parameters

Data Type: Dimension

URL Parameters: The end of a page view URL that includes UTM and other parameters.  

 

URL

Data type: Dimension

Description: The full URL of a page view. 

 

UTM Campaign

Data type: Dimension

Description: The UTM campaign parameter pulled from a page view.

 

UTM Content

Data type: Dimension

Description: The UTM content parameter pulled from a URL used to link to the destination. This includes identifiers such as paid keywords or more specific identifiers for campaigns.

 

UTM Medium

Data type: Dimension

Description: The UTM medium parameter pulled from the URL used to link to the destination.

The medium refers to the type of platform referrals came from.  If the medium is in parentheses such as (none), (organic), (referral) then that means they were inferred by Uberflip. Those without such as email, referral, or social were explicitly provided.

 

UTM Source

Data type: Dimension

Description: The UTM medium parameter pulled from the URL used to link to the destination.

The source is the actual platform referring traffic.  This includes Google.com, yourwebsite.com, and if it's (direct) then that means someone typed in the actual URL manually.

 

Distinct URLs

Data Type: Count

Description: A drill-able count of Distinct page view URLs that can be used to identify all the URLs where an item might be displayed. 

 

UTM Campaigns

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of distinct campaigns pulled from the campaign UTM parameter.  Campaigns are either manually set or set by your Marketing automation software / ad server.

 

UTM Source & Mediums

Data Type: Count

Description: A sum of the number of distinct UTM Source & Medium pairs.
